name: ISO 27005
description: Information security risk management - Guidelines for information security risk management

controls.title: Information Security Policies
controls.description: Management direction and support for information security
controls.implementationGuidance: Establish a comprehensive information security policy framework that covers all aspects of the organization's information security management system and is regularly reviewed and updated.
testingProcedures: Check policy review schedules and updates

controls.title: Review of Information Security Policies
controls.description: Information security policies shall be reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur
requirements: Regular policy reviews at planned intervals
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement a formal process for reviewing information security policies at regular intervals and when significant changes occur in the organization or its environment.

controls.title: Information Security Roles and Responsibilities
controls.description: All information security responsibilities shall be defined and allocated
requirements: Clear role definitions for information security
controls.implementationGuidance: Define and document information security roles and responsibilities for all personnel, including management, users, and service providers, and ensure they are clearly communicated.

controls.title: Segregation of Duties
controls.description: Conflicting duties and areas of responsibility shall be segregated
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement segregation of duties to prevent conflicts of interest and reduce the risk of fraud, error, or unauthorized access to information systems.

controls.title: Inventory of Assets
controls.description: Assets associated with information and information processing facilities shall be identified
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain an inventory of all information assets and assign ownership responsibilities to ensure proper protection and management.

controls.title: Ownership of Assets
controls.description: Assets maintained in the inventory shall be owned
controls.implementationGuidance: Assign clear ownership for all assets in the inventory and maintain ownership documentation to ensure accountability and proper management.

controls.title: Acceptable Use of Assets
controls.description: Rules for the acceptable use of information and of assets associated with information and information processing facilities shall be identified, documented, and implemented
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop and implement clear rules for the acceptable use of information assets to ensure proper usage and prevent misuse.

controls.title: Return of Assets
controls.description: All employees and external party users shall return all of the organization's assets in their possession upon termination of their employment, contract, or agreement
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement procedures to ensure all organizational assets are returned upon termination of employment or contracts to prevent loss or unauthorized access.

controls.title: Access Control Policy
controls.description: Access control policy shall be established, documented, and reviewed
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop and maintain access control policies that define user access rights and restrictions based on business requirements and security considerations.

controls.title: Access to Networks and Network Services
controls.description: Users shall only be provided with access to the network and network services that they have been specifically authorized to use
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement controls to ensure users only have access to authorized network services based on their job requirements and business needs.

controls.title: Cryptographic Controls
controls.description: Appropriate use of cryptographic controls shall be ensured
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement appropriate cryptographic controls to protect information confidentiality, integrity, and authenticity based on risk assessment and business requirements.

controls.title: Key Management
controls.description: A policy on the use, protection, and lifetime of cryptographic keys shall be developed and implemented
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop and implement comprehensive key management policies and procedures to ensure the secure generation, distribution, storage, and destruction of cryptographic keys.

controls.title: Physical and Environmental Security
controls.description: Physical and environmental security controls shall be implemented
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement appropriate physical and environmental security controls to protect information processing facilities and equipment from unauthorized access, damage, and interference.

controls.title: Documented Operating Procedures
controls.description: Operating procedures shall be documented and made available to all users who need them
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop and maintain documented operating procedures for all information processing facilities and ensure they are available to all users who need them.

controls.title: Network Security Management
controls.description: Networks shall be managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement comprehensive network security management to protect information in systems and applications from unauthorized access and threats.
